Pore/Structural Features.Pore Size: 5 Å, 6 Å (cavity size of 4AB18C6), ~8 Å (tetrahedral windows of MOF), ~12 Å (octahedral windows of MOF)

Other Information.Test Conditions: pH 6.0, 1 mM TlCl solution, -2 V applied voltage
Other Information.Additional Info: Tl+ exhibits preferential transport due to specific interaction with crown ether and weaker dehydration energy compared to Li+.

Other Information.Test Conditions: pH 6.0, 1 mM LiCl solution, -2 V applied voltage
Other Information.Additional Info: Li+ experiences stronger electrostatic attraction and cation-π interactions, impeding its transport in the presence of Tl+.
Mg2+ is excluded due to its larger hydrated diameter compared to the narrowest cavity (~5 Å) of 4AB18C6/MOF.
Ca2+ is excluded due to its larger hydrated diameter compared to the narrowest cavity (~5 Å) of 4AB18C6/MOF.

Sieving Mechanism: The sieving mechanism involves a combination of size exclusion, charge selectivity, and specific interactions with functional groups. The crown ether selectively binds to Tl+, facilitating its transport while inhibiting Li+.

Experimental Validation.Method: Current-voltage (I-V) characteristic measurements, ion permeation experiments, density functional theory (DFT) calculations, molecular dynamics (MD) simulations
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Tl+/Li+ selectivity: 30, Tl+ permeation rate: 5.72 mmol m-2 h-1

Other Information.Additional Info: The material demonstrates excellent long-term stability with no significant decrease in ion rectification ratio after four months.
